FERMENTABLE.NAME: Acidulated (BestMälz)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: BEST Acidulated Malt reduces the pH of the wort. This results in improved enzyme activity of the mash, greater yield and flavour stability as well as a lighter colour and a balanced aroma in the finished beer. It also represents an interesting alternative for breweries that have no mash acidification.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Aromatic (BestMälz)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: BEST Aromatic Malt will impart a distinct, almost exaggerated malt aroma and flavour to dark lagers, amber lagers, German Bocks and other beer styles, even at a rate as low as 10%. As with all BEST caramel malts, this malt is of exceptional quality, both due to its excellent processing characteristics and superior flavour.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black Malt R1000 (BestMälz)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: BEST Black Malt (roasted malt) gives the beer greater depth of colour and adds fine nuances of chocolate or coffee aromas. The malt flavour is also emphasised. The foam characteristics are not affected. The malt is produced from green or kiln-dried malt in an intensive roasting process. The colour of the malt can be adjusted to customer requirements with- in a range of ± 5%.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black Malt R1400 (BestMälz)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: BEST Black Malt (roasted malt) gives the beer greater depth of colour and adds fine nuances of chocolate or coffee aromas. The malt flavour is also emphasised. The foam characteristics are not affected. The malt is produced from green or kiln-dried malt in an intensive roasting process. The colour of the malt can be adjusted to customer requirements with- in a range of ± 5%.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Dark (BestMälz)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: BEST Caramel Malt dark (crystal malt) reinforces the typical "caramely" malt aroma of the beer. It gives the beer a significantly darker colour and increases foam stability. In addition, it enhances the full-bodied character of the beer. After the germination is finished, the green malt is stewed and roasted using a special process. The colour of the malt can be adjusted to customer requirements within a range of ± 10%. As with all BEST caramel malts, this malt is of exceptional quality, both due to its excellent processing characteristics and superior flavour. BEST Caramel Malt dark is available on two colour levels.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Light (BestMälz)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: BEST Caramel Malt light reinforces the typical "caramely" malt aroma of the beer. It gives the beer a darker colour and increases foam stability. In addition, it enhances the full-bodied character of the beer. After the germination is finished, the green malt is stewed and gently roasted using a special process. This produces the special caramel aroma. As with all BEST caramel malts, this malt is of exceptional quality, both due to its excellent processing characteristics and superior flavour.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Pils (BestMälz)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: BEST Caramel Malt Pils optimises the foam properties and full-bodied character of the beer. The malt charac-ter resembles that of BEST Pilsner malt. The malt is produced from high-quality two-row spring barley, which was grown in the best German and Eu-ropean barley regions. After the germination is finished, the green malt is stewed and gently roasted using a special process. This produces the special caramel aroma. As with all BEST caramel malts, this malt is of exceptional quality, both due to its excellent processing characteristics and superior flavour.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Melanoidin (BestMälz)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: BEST Melanoidin Malt contains a particularly large amount of dextrins. It gives the beer a strong flavour and a slightly reddish colour. The full-bodied nature of the beer is enhanced. It is produced according to a special kilning process. The malt is characterised by its ease of processing. The malt is produced from high-quality two-row spring barley, which was grown in the best German and European barley regions.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich (BestMälz)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: BEST Munich Malt intensifies the colour of the beer and emphasises the malt aroma of dark beer in an inviting way. This malt is produced using a special malting process designed to bring out certain desirable qualities, such as high solubility. The malt is produced from high-quality two-row spring barley, which was grown in the best German and European barley regions. The BEST Munich Malt is available in two different colour levels.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich Dark (BestMälz)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: BEST Munich Malt intensifies the colour of the beer and emphasises the malt aroma of dark beer in an inviting way. This malt is produced using a special malting process designed to bring out certain desirable qualities, such as high solubility. The malt is produced from high-quality two-row spring barley, which was grown in the best German and European barley regions. The BEST Munich Malt is available in two different colour levels.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Ale (BestMälz)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: BEST Pale Ale Malt deepens the light "golden" colour of top-fermented beers, creating a pleasant flavour. The malt is produced from high-quality two-row spring bar-ley, which was grown in the best German and European barley regions. It is an excellent base malt for brewing many different styles of British Pale Ale as well as for brewing Kölsch beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsen (BestMälz)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Our first class BEST Pilsen Malt gives beer a fresh and rounded taste. It can be used for all types of light beer. It also forms an excellent "light" and enzyme-rich foundation for almost all beer styles. The malt is produced from high-quality two-row spring barley, which was grown in the best German and European barley re- gions. Malt characteristics: low protein levels, high extract content, light colour and high enzymatic activity. BEST Pilsen Malt is also available in organic-quality. Probably the best base malt for your best beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: RedX (BestMälz)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: BEST Red X malt is specially created for brewing red-tinted beers. You can use BEST Red X for up to 100% of your grain bill - no other malt is required. Offering exceptional reliability and optimal processability, BEST Red X can be employed to brew consistently fiery beers with intense reddish hues. Its full-bodied flavor and attractive, unique color coupled with easy han-dling in the brewery make BEST Red X the best choice for creating a broad range of new beers, such as red-tinted wheat beers. As with all BEST malts, BEST Red X is produced using a special malting procedure exclusively from two-rowed spring malting barley from recognized and thor-oughly tested barley varieties.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Vienna (BestMälz)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: BEST Vienna Malt deepens the light and brilliant colour of the beer and creates a pleasant, full-bodied taste. Selected malting barley is used to produce the malt and it is created according to a special malting process. This malt also has a high enzymatic potential. The malt is produced from high-quality two-row spring barley, which was grown in the best German and European barley regions

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat (BestMälz)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: BEST Wheat Malt emphasises the effervescent freshness and the typical top-fermented flavour of wheat beer. It is produced from high quality brewing wheat. Malting processes adapted to the raw material high-light the particular qualities of this malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Dark (BestMälz)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: BEST Wheat Malt dark emphasises the effervescent freshness and the typical top-fermented flavour of wheat beer in the same way as the light wheat malt. In addition, the colour and the aroma of the beer is in-tensified. It is produced from high quality brewing wheat. Malt-ing processes adapted to the raw material highlight the particular qualities of this malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Amber Malt Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Thomas Coopers Amber Malt Extract, produced by brewers for brewers, is an ideal adjunct for brews where more depth of flavour and colour is required. Available in 1.5kg cans. Colour - 340EBC

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Australian Bitter Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Much lighter in colour and the tiniest bit less bitter than its English cousin, this premium beer is a true blue salute to great Aussie bitter.
Weight - 1.7kg, Colour - 70EBC, Bitterness - 495IBU

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Australian Pale Ale Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
The closest a brewer can get to the famed Coopers Original Pale Ale - crisp bitterness balanced with fruity and floral characters making a compellingly flavoured beer for all occasions.
Weight - 1.7kg, Colour - 90EBC, Bitterness - 340IBU

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Canadian Blonde Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Clean, pale malt flavours, a light bodied palate with malt aromas and a hint of spicy hops. A pale straw coloured beer... your cure to have more fun with.
Weight - 1.7kg, Colour - 70EBC, Bitterness - 420IBU, Aroma Hop - Spicy Top Notes

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Coopers LME - Amber
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Unhopped amber color liquid extract. Use as a base malt for any Ale. Examples: Amber ale, India Pale Ale, Munich style, Marzen, Bock

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Coopers LME - Dark
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Unhopped dark liquid extract. Use as a base malt for any dark beer. Examples: Porter, Brown ale, Bock, Oktoberfest, Stouts

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Coopers LME - Light
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Unhopped pale liquid extract. Use as a base malt for any ale or lager.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Coopers LME - Wheat
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Unhopped Wheat liquid malt extract. Contains approx 60% Wheat, 40% Barley Use for Bavarian wheats, weizens, weiss and dunkel weizen styles.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Dark Ale Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
A generous mouthfeel dominated by roasted malt flavours, wrapped up in a rich mahogany colour and capped off with a creamy head.
Weight - 1.7kg, Colour - 650EBC, Bitterness - 590IBU

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Dark Malt Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Thomas Coopers Dark Malt Extract, produced by brewers for brewers, is an excellent adjunct for dark brews Available in 1.5kg cans Colour - 1650EBC

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Draught Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Delicately hoppy with a slight bitter finish, this light, yellow-gold brew with a packed white head delivers a medium bodied palate and floral nose.
Weight - 1.7kg, Colour - 130EBC, Bitterness - 420IBU

FERMENTABLE.NAME: English Bitter Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
A coppery-brown colour with hues of red, a creamy head, floral aroma and a blend of toasty-sweet malt flavours that'll have you transported back to the early 1800s. By eck, it's grand.
Weight - 1.7kg, Colour - 420EBC, Bitterness - 590IBU, Aroma Hop - Styrian Golding

FERMENTABLE.NAME: European Lager Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Capturing the style and essence of the very fine lagers exported from Northern Europe.
Weight - 1.7kg, Colour - 90EBC, Bitterness - 340IBU, Aroma Hop - European Blend Top Note

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Heritage Lager Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
A perfect representation of a premium lager with a rich yellow-gold colour and a tightly packed, white head. Prominent European hop aroma with sufficient hop bitterness and a clean finish.
Weight - 1.7kg, Colour - 90EBC, Bitterness - 390IBU, Aroma Hop - European Base Note Blend

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Honey - Eucalyptus
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: A rich distinctive honey made from bees foraging Eucalyptus trees in Australia. A full body honey with hints of Eucalyptus.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: India Pale Ale Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
A strong, robust ale with bold malt characters with very high hopping levels. It carries all the hallmarks of a genuine India Pale Ale from the 'Mother Land', just like the one first brewed in 1868 by Coopers.
Weight - 1.7kg, Colour - 230EBC, Bitterness - 710IBU, Aroma Hop - Styrian Golding

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Irish Stout Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Rich and dark with coffee, chocolate and licorice aromas. To think of all that silky, smooth, malted, roasty-ness without licking your lips is impossible.
Weight - 1.7kg, Colour - 1500EBC, Bitterness - 560IBU

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Lager Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
A true blue Aussie lager with plenty of character. Light to medium palate with subtle malt and hop flavours. A clear finish and inviting golden-straw colour.
Weight - 1.7kg, Colour - 90EBC, Bitterness - 390IBU

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Light Malt Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Thomas Coopers Light Malt Extract, produced by brewers for brewers, is ideal as a quality adjunct for brews intended to be light in colour. Available in 1.5kg cans. Colour - 53EBC

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Mexican Cerveza Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
The ultimate thirst quencher. A lighter style beer with a fresh, clean taste designed for refreshment in the heat of Central America.
Weight - 1.7kg, Colour - 53EBC, Bitterness - 270IBU, Aroma Hop - Spicy Top Notes with Tetra

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsener Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Don't let the pale, straw colour fool you. This classic pilsener has a bold, spicy Saaz hop aroma. It's crisp and dry with a cleansing bitterness.
Weight - 1.7kg, Colour - 70EBC, Bitterness - 420IBU, Aroma Hop - Saaz

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Real Ale Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Traditional ale like it should be - bright golden colour, strong head, generous mouthfeel and a moderately bitter finish.
Weight - 1.7kg, Colour - 230EBC, Bitterness - 560IBU

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Sparkling Ale Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Fruity esters to the nose with a full, malty and generously hopped finish to the mouth. Meet Pale Ale's big brother.
Weight - 1.7kg, Colour - 90EBC, Bitterness - 490IBU

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Stout Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Dark brown with a cappuccino-like, persistent creamy head. Dark and malty with a blend of coffee and chocolate aromas. Bring on winter.
Weight - 1.7kg, Colour - 1800EBC, Bitterness - 710IBU

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Traditional Draught Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Discerning draught lovers will delight at the combination of hops and malt and the palate cleansing freshness of this outstanding beer.
Weight - 1.7kg, Colour - 130EBC, Bitterness - 420IBU, Aroma Hop - Cascade

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Beer Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Considered to be the 'champagne of beers' by many. Pale, cloudy and refreshingly spritzy with a delicious creamy frothiness.
Weight - 1.7kg, Colour - 65EBC, Bitterness - 300IBU

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt Extract (Coopers)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Thomas Coopers Wheat Malt Extract, produced by brewers for brewers, is an excellent adjunct for brews where softer mouth-feel and improved head retention is required. Available in 1.5kg cans. Colour - 65EBC

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Biscuit Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Use for English ales, brown ales and porters. Adds a biscuit like flavor and aroma. Can be used as a substitute for toasted malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Abbey malt (Castle Malting)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Låg enzymatisk aktivitet, behöver mäskas tillsammans med en basmalt för full konversion.Abbey malt är en mer rostad form av Pale malt. Ger en stark smak av bakat bröd, nötter och frukter. Abbey malt har en bitter smak som mognar med åldrande.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Aromamalt (Castle Malting)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Aroma malt ger rik maltig doft och smak till bärnstens färgade och mörka lager öl. Jämfört med andra traditionella färgade malt sorter, ger en mjukare bitterhet. Används till mycket aromatisk öl och har enzymatisk kraft för självkonvertering.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Biscuit malt (Castle Malting)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Måste mäskas med en basmalt för full konversion, inga egna enzymer. Biscuit malt ger en mycket uttalad "Toasty" finish i öl. Förmedlar en varm bröd och kex doft och smak. Denna malt används för att förbättra rostade smak och arom i tex Abbey Ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Café Light (Castle Malting)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Förmedlar en mild och nötaktig kaffe-liknande smak och arom till öl. Lägger komplexitet till mörk ale. Stärker färgen. För tex Stouts, Porters, och något i Brown Ales för inslag av färskt rostat kaffe.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Cara Blond 20 (Castle Malting)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: En blek belgisk karamell malt. Användningsområde: Ljus lageröl, ljus ale och Belgiska Wit. Rekommenderad max giva: upp till 20%. Ger en mild karamell-söt doft och lägger gyllene färg till ditt öl. En utmärkande egenskap hos alla karamell malter är glasaktighet. Den glasartade frövitan skapar önskvärda icke-jäsbara komponenter som ger sann karamell malt förmåga att bidra med ökad munkänsla, skum och ökad skum stabilitet.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Cara Ruby 50 (Castle Malting)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: En medium färgad belgisk karamell malt. Användningsområde:Brown Ales, Brune des Flandres, Bock och Skottska Ales. Ger en rik karamell-söt doft, kola-liknande smak och ger en ljus bärnsten till rödaktig färg till ditt öl. En utmärkande egenskap hos alla karamell malter är glasaktighet. Den glasartade frövitan skapar önskvärda icke-jäsbara komponenter som ger sann karamell malt förmåga att bidra med ökad munkänsla, skum och ökad skum stabilitet.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chokladmalt (Castle Malting)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Choklad Malt är en mycket rostad malt med en djup brun färg. Används för att justera färgen på öl och skänker en nötaktig, rostad smak av mörk choklad och kaffe. Mildare än blackmalt och rostat korn. Till tex Stout, Porter och Brown Ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsnermalt 6RW (Castle Malting)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Framställd av sexradigt vinterkorn i finaste kvalitet. Välmodifierad malt som innehåller mer protein och har en högre enzymatisk aktivitet än vanlig tvåradig pilsnermalt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rökmalt (Castle Malting)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Rökt över Skotsk torv. Förmedlar en distinkt rökig, kryddig doft och smak, typiskt för klassiska tyska öl stilar. Rökt öl bryggt med Castle Maltings Rök malt smakar som en skogsbrand - men på ett bra sätt!
Användnigsområde: Skotska Ales , Porters, Tyska Rököl och Special öl.
Rekomenderad giva max 5%

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Special B (Castle Malting)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Mycket speciell belgisk karkellmalt.Ger en djupt röd till mörkt brun-svart färg och fylligare kropp, unik rik maltig smak och arom av russin, nötter och plommon. Används tex till Abbey Ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Aromatic Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Provides a very strong malt flavor and aroma to your beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Candi Sugar, Amber
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Crystalized Candi Sugar (Sucrose) used in many Belgian Tripels, Dubbels, and holiday ales. Adds head retention and sweet aroma to beer. Darker variants also add color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Candi Sugar, Clear
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Crystalized Candi Sugar (Sucrose) used in many Belgian Tripels, Dubbels, and holiday ales. Adds head retention and sweet aroma to beer. Darker variants also add color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Candi Sugar, Dark
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Crystalized Candi Sugar (Sucrose) used in many Belgian Tripels, Dubbels, and holiday ales. Adds head retention and sweet aroma to beer. Darker variants also add color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramunich Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Caramel, copper colored malt. Used in Belgian ales and German bocks.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caravienne Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Light Belgian crystal malt. Used in light Trappist and Abbey style Belgian ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chateau Caragold (Castle)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Belgian caramel-style malts. High temperature of germination. Taste development at up to 220°C, intense aroma. Impart caramel-sweet aroma adding golden to rich amber colour to beer. A distinguishing characteristic of all caramel malts is glassiness. This glassy endosperm creates the desirable non-fermentable components that give true caramel malt the ability to contribute mouthfeel, foam, foam retention, and extended beer stability.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chateau Pale Ale Malt (Castle)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Belgian light-coloured base malt. Kilning at up to 90-95°C. Usually used as a base malt or in combination with Pilsen 2RS malt to impart a richer malt flavour and additional colour. Being deeper in colour, this malt can add a golden hue to the wort. It is used with strong yeasts to produce amber and bitter beers. Château Pale Ale malt is kilned longer and is usually better modified, providing a more pronounced flavour than Pilsen 2RS. The enzymatic activity of Château Pale Ale malt is sufficient when used with large proportion of non-enzymatic specialty malts. Pale ale styles and bitter beers, most traditional English beer styles. Up to 100% of the mix.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Ale (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.EXTRACT_SUBSTITUTE: Briess Base Malts, Caramel 60L Malt, Munich Malt

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Malt (2 Row) Bel
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Base malt for all beer styles Higher potential yield than US, English equivalent pale ale malts

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsner (2 Row) Bel
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Belgian base malt for Continental lagers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Special B Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Extreme caramel aroma and flavored malt. Used in dark Belgian Abbey and Trappist ales. Unique flavor and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt, Bel
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malted wheat for use in Wheat beers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: ESB Pale Malt (Gambrinus)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: "Extra Special British" pale malt has been produced for brewers seeking a North American malt with the unique flavor imparted by British pale malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Honey Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Intensely sweet - adds a sweet malty flavor sometimes associated with honey. Also called Brumalt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Honey Malt (Gambrinus)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: This malt is similar in style to German "brumalt", but it really doesn't compare to any other malt with its honey-like taste and residual sweetness. Best used in brown ales, porters, and stouts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich Dark 30L (Gambrinus)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: This deep kilned malt is ideal where unique malt flavor and rich color is sought.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich Light 10L (Gambrinus)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: This mellow kilned malt is ideal where unique malt flavor and rich aroma, is sought.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Organic 2row Pale Malt (Gambrinus)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Produced from only the finest Certified Organic Canadian 2-row Barley, this malt is well modified, clean tasting, and moderate in total protein.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Organic Munich 10L (Gambrinus)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Produced from only the finest Certified Organic Canadian 2-row Barley, this deep kilned malt is ideal where unique malt flavor and rich color is sought.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Organic Pilsner (Gambrinus)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Organic Pilsner malt from Gambrunus suitable for many Continental beer styles.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Organic Wheat (Gambrinus)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Produced from Canadian wheat, this Certified Organic Wheat malt may be used in wheat beers of all types.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Malt, 2 row (Gambrinus)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Gambrinus brewers pale malt, suitable for use as a base for many beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsner (2 row) (Gambrinus)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Processed from the finest Canadian two-row available, this very low protein base malt may be used in all types of European style beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Vienna Malt (Gambrinus)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Higher kilning temperatures give this Vienna malt its deep golden color and strong malt flavor.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt (Gambrinus)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Processed from the finest Canadian wheat available, this wheat malt may be used in wheat beers of all types.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Marin Oufroy
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
French Cider Apple. For cider - Full mouthfeel. Sherry-like. Noticeable sweetness with the low acidity. Soft tannins. Woody. Baked apple, raisin. Alcohol finish. Overall Impression - Excellent cider. Rich, complex. Highly recommended. Total tannins=0.31%.
For more info see: https://brixcider.com/marin-oufroy-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Snow
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Variable sized apple also known as Fameuse. Bi-color green and red. Originated from plantings by French settlers in Quebec. For cider - Soft mouthfeel and a bit thin. Mildly tart with some lingering acidity. Little to no noticeable tannins. Overall Impression - A light, refreshing cider. A good cider base with balanced acidity that would blend well with a bittersweet.Total tannins=0.06%.
For more info see - https://brixcider.com/snow-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Horneburger Pancake
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
From Northern Germany. For cider - Medium body. Medium to high acidity. Subtle but noticeable bitterness. Little astringency. Long, tart finish. Makes a pretty good cider, would add some acidity, unique aroma, and subtle bitterness to a blend.Total tannins=0.13%.
For more info see: https://brixcider.com/horneburger-pancake

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Acid Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Acid malt contains acids from natural lactic acids. Used by German brewers to adjust malt PH without chemicals to adhere to German purity laws. Also enhances the head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Acidulated (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Used in Germany to lower PH levels without resorting to chemicals. Lowers mash pH levels, lightens color, improves flavor stability.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Early Windsor
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Known as Alkmene in Germany where it was initially grown. For cider - Medium to light body. Medium to high acidity. Long tart finish. Slightly drying but otherwise no noticeable tannins.. Total tannins=0.11%.
For more info see: https://brixcider.com/earlywindsor

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Brumalt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark German malt developed to add malt flavor of Alt, Marzen and Oktoberfest beers. Helps create authentic maltiness without having to do a decoction mash. Rarely available for homebrewers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caraamber (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Medium colored caramel malt. Bocks, dark ales, red and amber lagers and ales. Improves flavour stability and enhances colour

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caraaroma
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Very dark crystal malt - similar to a crystal 120 or Caramunich 120 malt. Adds strong caramel flavor, red color, and malty aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caraaroma (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Very dark caramel malt with aromatic properties. Adds deep red color and aroma. Amber ales, dark lagers, bocks. Substitute for "Belgian Special B" or 120L caramel malts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa I
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Used to intensify aroma and color in dark, Munich beers and stouts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa I (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Chocolate malt. Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers. Adds color and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa II
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Used to intensify aroma and color in dark, Munich beers and stouts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa II (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Chocolate malt. Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers. Adds color and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa III
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark color and aroma - used in some German beers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa III (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Chocolate malt. Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers. Adds color and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa Special I (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Chocolate malt. Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers. Adds color and aroma. De-husked, smoother tasting

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa Special II (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: De-husked chocolate malt for a smoother flavor. Adds body, color, aroma. Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa Special III (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: De-husked chocolate malt for a smoother flavour. Dark version. Adds color and aroma. Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafoam (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Carafoam (also called Carapils) adds body and head retention without substantially altering flavor. Up to 10% for light beers, 40% for mashed beers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carahell (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Light colored caramel malt. Adds body, color and aroma. Use up to 30% in low alcohol beers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Rye (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Caramel malt made with a rye base. Adds aroma, flavor and color. Used in rye styles.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Wheat Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Caramel wheat malt - emphasizes wheat malt aroma and adds color to the beer. Popular for Dunkelweizens. Also known as Carawheat -- which is a registered trademark of Wyermann Malting.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramunich I (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: German crystal malt. Adds maltiness, flavor, color and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramunich II (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: German crystal malt. Adds maltiness, aroma, color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramunich III (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: German crystal malt. Adds maltiness, body, aroma and color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carared (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Medium crystal malt, adds a body and reddish color. Red ales and lagers, Scottish ales. Full body and aroma, deep red colour

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carawheat (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Used in wheat beers and ales. A wheat version of crystal malt. Promotes fuller flavor, wheat malt aroma and enhanced color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Rye (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Roasted malt made with a rye base. Adds aroma, flavor and color. Used in rye styles.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Rye Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Primarily used for color and aroma in top-fermented specialty beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Wheat (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Chocholate malt made with a wheat base. Adds aroma and color. Alts and dark wheat beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Wheat Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Intensifies aroma and color in top-fermented beers such as dark wheat beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Melanoiden Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Aromatic malt from Banberg, Germany. Promotes a full flavor and rounds off beer color. Promotes deep red color and malty flavor.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Melanoidin (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Red colored malt that improved head retention and stability. Used in red lagers, ales, dark beers. Intense red colour and malty aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich I (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Light Munich malt. May be used as a base for many German beer styles. Fest beers, bocks, ales. Enhances malty flavour and aroma

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich II (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Darker Munich Malt. Used as a base malt in many German beer styles. Fest beers, bocks and ales. Enhances malt flavour and aroma

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malty-sweet flavor characteristic and adds a reddish amber color to the beer. Does not contribute signficantly to body or head retention. Use for: Bock, Porter, Marzen, Oktoberfest beers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Malt (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pale base malt for all ales and lagers. Good general purpose malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsner (2 Row) Ger
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: German base for Pilsners and Bohemian Lagers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsner (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pilsner base malt for all pilsners, lagers. Highly modified malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rye Malt (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Rye malt for rye style beers. Up to 50% may be used in some rye styles. Adds distinctive rye flavor and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Sinamar (Wyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: A unique coloring agent in liquid form. Schwartz beer, colour adjustment.Roast malt beer extract.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Smoked (BestMälz)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: BEST Smoked Malt gives beer a typical smoky flavour (similar to that in smoked ham). The quantity used will influence the intensity of the beech wood or whisky flavour. This malt can also be used for distillates. It has a high enzymatic activity.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Smoked Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malt that has been smoked over an open fire. Creates a distinctive "smoked" flavor and aroma. Used primarily for German Rauchbier but can also be added to Brown Ales and Porters.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Smoked Malt (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Smoked flavor and aroma base malt. Used in smoked ales, lagers and wheat beers, primarily German styles.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Vienna Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Kiln dried malt darker than Pale Malt, but not as dark as Munich Malt Imparts a golden to orange color to the beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Vienna Malt (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Vienna base malt - used in many continental beer styles. Full bodied, golden color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt, Dark
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark malted wheat base for use in dark wheat styles such as Dunkleweizen.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt, Dark (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Darker wheat malt, used as a base malt in many wheat styles. Wheat beers, Koelsch, Alts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt, Ger
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malted wheat base for use in all wheat styles

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt, Pale (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pale wheat malt, used as a base malt in many wheat styles. Wheat beers, Koelsch, Alts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat, Roasted
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Also called Chocolate Wheat Malt. Kilned raw wheat - adds a deep, dark brown color to dunkelweizens and other dark beer styles. Roasted, woody, charcoal or burnt toast flavor depending on degree of roasting.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Honey - Chesnut
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Produced primarily in Italy from the blossoms of chesnut trees. Has a unique aroma and slightly bitter flavor. Amber in color, and only mildly sweet.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Honey - Heather
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Slightly bitter with an aftertaste of burnt caramel. Dark amber in color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Homemade Amber Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Home made amber malt. Roasted for 30min at 180C.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Homemade Brown Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Baked in the oven. 30min @ 100C, 30min @ 150C, 30min @180C.
Imparts a dry, biscuit flavor. Used in nut brown ales, porters and some Belgian ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Homemade Crystal 150
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
2kg soaked overnight Converted for 1hr at 65C Dried for 4+hr at 120C Roasted for 15min at 180C Dried for another 1+hr at 120C
Process problems: large quantity made for a struggle drying out, resulting in extra caramelisation. Visually similar to Caraaroma, this data based on that profile.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: NFP Pale Liquid Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Unhopped pale liquid extract. Use as a base malt for any ale or lager.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Oats, Flaked (Jungle Oats)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, mouth feel and head retention to the beer Used in oatmeal stouts and porters Adds substantial protein haze to light beers Protein rest recommended unless flakes are pregelatinized

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Malt (2 Row) RSA
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Base malt for all beer styles. Malted at SAB Caledon Maltsters

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Swiss Limbertwig
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
For cider - Medium body. Medium to high acidity. Mild bitterness and astringency fills out the cider. Overall Impression - Nice, balanced. Good all around. Total tannins=0.20%.
For more info see - https://brixcider.com/swiss-limbertwig-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Amber Malt (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Perhaps the most versatile of all Simpsons' roasted products, Simpsons' Amber Malt can be used in a wide variety of beers to add biscuity toasty notes and a beautiful brown hue. Its delicate roast flavour makes it suitable for adding toasty notes to all Dark Beers, as well as lighter Ales and Lagers. Amber Malt brings a clean, crisp dryness to balance delicate floral hops and increases foam stability.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - London Pippen
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Crisp with a pleasant apple flavor but not very juicy. For cider - Fresh apple flavor. Refreshing and balanced. Medium body, medium acidity, little to no tannin.
Overall Impression - Enjoyable cider. Classic apple flavor. Total tannins=0.07%.
For more info see: https://brixcider.com/london-pippen-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Pitmaston Pineapple
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Old English heiloom. For cider - Medium body. Impressively tart. Like pineapple juice without any sugar. Brisk, full flavor. Long, tart finish. Little noticeable tannins.
Overall Impression - A distinctive cider. Too acidic on its own for some palettes. Would liven up a blend with some tropical tang. Total tannins=0.10%.
For more info see - https://brixcider.com/pitmaston-pineapple-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Tremlett's Bitter
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Intense, well known English cider apple very high in tannins. For cider -Unfortunately we did not have enough juice from Tremlett's Bitter to create a single varietal cider for further testing. Total tannins=1.20%.
For more info see - https://brixcider.com/tremletts-bitter

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Yarlington Mill
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Traditional English Cider apple. For cider - Full body. Rich. Slight residual sweetness is noticeable with the low acidity. Pleasant tannins - lightly drying and slight bitterness. Notes of oak, spiced rum, molasses, anise.
Overall Impression - Wow! Definitely a stand out cider apple. Wish more ciders tasted like that. Total tannins=0.20%.
For more info see - https://brixcider.com/yarlington-mill

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Aromatic Malt (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: The secret weapon in the British Ale Brewer's arsenal, Simpsons' aromatic malt has a slightly higher acidity to balance pH. Its complex sweetness with sour after-notes gives a magnificent mouthfeel. This, combined with intense malty notes and raisin, makes aromatic malt a versatile product that can be used from as little as 5% to give warm honey aromas and up to 50% as a base malt for dark beers to give raisin and plum notes. Brings a beautiful brown depth of colour.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black Malt (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Simpsons' Black Malt is excellent for darkening beer colour without imparting too much astringency or roast characteristics. The flavour is surprisingly neutral with a clean dryness making it an incredibly versatile product.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Brown Malt (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Simpsons' Brown Malt imparts a rich coffee aroma ideal for Stouts and Porters. It delivers a smooth mouthfeel as well as increasing foam stability. The hue is a deep mahogany that brings warmth and depth to dark beers. Often a forgotten malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramalt (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Simpson's Caramalt is a chewy, sweet taste of Heaven. It contributes golden hued colour enhacement and flavour enrichment from its mild toffee notes in Lagers and Extra Pale Ales. Due to its low colour, it is incredibly versatile and can be used to enhance almost any Beer style that needs a little sweetnes.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramalt, Premium English (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Simpson's Premium English Caramalt is their top of the range Cara. Used in light coloured beers, it will impart a deliciously sweet malty flavour without the burnt character that higher colour crystals bring. Excellent for colour adjustment on delicately flavoured lagers and ales it gives a slight colour increase. Also works well in highly hopped beer to balance out bitterness and citrus aromas.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Malt (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Simpsons' Chocolate Malt gives beer a stunning dark brown colour. Chocolate overtones and hints of coffee bring richness and complexity at higher usages in Stouts and Porters.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Crystal, DRC® (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Due to its unique production process, Simpsons' DRC® can be used to substitute darker roasted malts in dark beers where the astringency and bitterness inherent to roast malts is not desired. This means that it can be used at a higher rate in the grist to add complex caramel and dried fruit notes with a beautiful red-brown hue.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Crystal, Dark (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: With Simpsons' Crystal Dark, we get into the delicious realms of complex toffee and burnt sugar but without the astringency of roasted malt. Their unique roasting process for crystals allows them to produce exceptional uniformity in each batch, to ensure each grain of malt is perfectly crystallized.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Crystal, Extra Dark (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: The beautiful rich brown of the grain gives an insight to the exquisite dried fruit and burnt sugar flavours that are imparted by this expertly crafted dark crystal. Used in small amounts, this malt will help balance flavour and colour in dark beers whilst enhancing head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Crystal, Heritage (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: The uniformity and excellent malting characteristics that have ensured Maris Otter has been the favoured barley variety of the British Brewer, also lends itself to ensure exceptionally good crystal malt. Simpsons have hand crafted this heritage barley variety to produce an outstanding medium crystal bringing flavour and depth of colour to Ales and Bitters.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Crystal, Light (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Simpson's Crystal Light brings mild caramel and toffee flavours to beers whilst contributing a beautiful golden hue. Its clean, mild sweetness brings depth of flavour to beers where extra body is required, without adding overtly toasted or roasted characters.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Crystal, Medium (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Caramel and toffee notes come to the forefront in Simpsons' Crystal Medium. Their expert roasters use their skills to bring you a crystal that adds stunning deep golden and red hues to your beer, whilst imparting deeper caramel notes.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Crystal, T50 (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: The secret is in the name - Target 50! Each batch targets 50 Lovibond colour (130EBC). The specification on Crystal T50 was created with one of their most acclaimed clients in mind. With an exceptionally tight consistency - it's fantastic crystal that crunches in the mouth offering. Crystal T50 provides amazing colour and delicate malty flavours to beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Imperial Malt (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Simpson's Imperial Malt imparts a full-bodied flavour and biscuit aroma. The warm brown notes it adds to the wort intensify the dept of colour, without compromising enzymic activity.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Lager Malt (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Finest Lager Malt is a superb low colour lager malt. Well modified, high extract UK spring two row barley gives high enzymic activity, low colour, low nitrogen and exceptional Brewhouse performance. It can be used to make any style of lager with its clean, light malty taste.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich Malt (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Simpson's Munich malt brings rich malty flavours and golden hues to light beers. If you are struggling to bring up the mouthfeel in really hoppy keg beers, try adding a generous proportion of Munich to your grist. An excellent base malt for Strong Bitter, Dark Amber Ales, Brown Ales and Milds. It brings intense colour and malty notes without compromising enzymic action. Despite its continental name, this malt provides a fantastic malty base for British Ales and Bitters.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Oats, Golden Naked®; (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: This huskless oat crystal malt is quite simply delicious. An exotic ingredient for the adventurous brewer, it brings a subtle nutty flavour. Its creaminess brings mouthfeel and balance to strong, hop forward beers. One taste and we're sure you'll be inspired to start creating a new recipe.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Oats, Malted (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Simpsons Malted Oats have large, thick husks which helps with run off. Once you crack it open, the creaminess of the oats releases a silky smoothness which imparts a sumptuous velvety texture to your beer. This fullness allows it to take as many hops as you can throw at it for a juice bomb, providing balance. In more traditional usage, Malted Oats provide the back bone of creaminess in Oatmeal Stouts and Porters, smoothing the astringency that may result from the heavy use of roasted grains and adding a complexity of flavour. Malted Oats is a hugely versatile product that can be added to any beer style to impart a creamy, velvety smooth mouthfeel.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Ale Malt, Extra (Simpsons )
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Extra Pale Ale Malt is an excellent base malt for Brewers who require a low colour, well modified malt. The plump grains of UK two-row barley ensure uniformity and consistency, as well as good extract and enzymic activity. If you're limited on base malt storage, it doubles as a great light coloured base for both Lagers and Ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Ale, Finest Maris Otter (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Maris Otter's superior Brewhouse performance is fantastic. The Rolls Royce of malts for the traditional brewer, this legendary heritage barley variety is the Traditional English Bitter base malt. It produces a rich malty flavour with exceptional Brewhouse performance and beer clarity, due to its low nitrogen content and high extract.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Ale, Golden Promise®; (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: When you need a high performing well balanced malt to complement your big hops, you won't lose out on body. This gives the biggest base of any malt without adding colour, resulting in exceptional beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Ale, Low Colour Maris Otter (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: If you require a well modified, high performing malt, but with a low colour, look no further than Low Colour Maris Otter. This heritage barley variety is used to produce an exceptional quality base malts, with high extract and enzymic activity and low nitrogen content. It is kilned at a low temperature, making it perfect for Cask IPAs and Light Coloured Ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Chocolate (Thomas Fawcett)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Less highly-roasted than regular chocolate malt. Will add dark brown color and a mild chocolate/coffee flavor to dark milds, brown ales, stouts, and porters.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Malt, Best (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: For the principal ingredient in keg, bottle or cask ales, Simpsons use top quality UK two-row barley to produce a plump, well-modified malt with good extract and enzymic activity. The versatility of this base malt lends itself to balance hoppy beers or provide a robust malty note to a Traditional Bitter or Belgian-style beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rye, Malted (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malted Rye contributes a spicy rye note to beers. It adds a unique flavour to beer giving fullness and mouthfeel. Great used in conjunction with Red Rye Crystal. Rice husks are recommended if using at greater than 20% to aid filtration. As well as using in traditional Rye Beers, Malted Rye is excellent in hoppy Beer styles, complimenting citrus hops with its spice.Styles: Rye IPA and Speciality Beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rye, Red Crystal (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Red Rye Crystal imparts a beautiful ruby red hue to beers whilst offering a well-rounded, sweet, malty flavour. Great Autumnal flavour for seasonal beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Unmalted Roasted Barley (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Roasted Barley is a typical ingredient of dry Irish Stouts. Although the colour specification is very similar to Black Malt, Roasted Barley has an intense coffee/roast flavour, bestowing a deep dark colour with flavours to match.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Vienna Malt (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Simpson's Vienna malt enhances the light colour, flavour and aroma of all light beers. Light, bready, malty notes bring body to Light Ales, Best Bitters and Czech Lagers. Use as a base malt for highly hopped IPA and American Ales to provide great balance and depth.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat, Malt (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Wheat malt can be added at 5% to most light beers to increase foam stability without affecting haze or flavour. Used up to 70% as a base malt for wheat beer, it imparts a bready flavour and characteristic citrus notes.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Amber Dry Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Amber colored dry malt extract, for general purpose use. Use in any medium to dark colored beer. Examples: Ales, Marzens, Amber Ale, India Pale Ale

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Amber Liquid Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Unhopped amber color liquid extract. Use as a base malt for any Ale. Examples: Amber ale, India Pale Ale, Munich style, Marzen, Bock

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Black Gilliflower
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Cider making variety. Medium to medium large. Full bodied, balanced, sharp cider apple with a pleasant bite. Notable but mild tannins, some woody notes. Wine like. Total tannins=0.14%
For more info see: https://brixcider.com/black-gilliflower-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Blenheim Orange
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
For cider - low in aroma, tart, highly acidic with some astringency. Somewhat tart on its own but may be a good apple for a blend. Total tannins = 0.12%.
For more info see: https://brixcider.com/blenheim-orange

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Carrol
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
For cider - medium to light in body, medium acidity, a mild tart apple. Slightly more astringent than low tannin would expect. Total tannins=0.08%.
For more info see: https://brixcider.com/carroll

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Christmas Pearmain
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
For cider - Medium to light body. Moderate to slightly high acidity with a long finish. Little in the way of tannins. Good cider base, straightforward. Total tannins=0.11%.
For more info see: https://brixcider.com/christmas-pearmain-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Coopers Market
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
For cider -Medium body. Dominated by tart, lingering green apple acidity, somewhat biting but not overly harsh. Little noticeable tannins. Total tannins=0.07%.
For more info see: https://brixcider.com/coopers-market-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Cortland
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Popular eating apple bred in NY in the late 1800s. For cider -Low to medium body. Moderate acidity - starts mild then builds and fades slowly. Little to no noticeable tannins. Mild sour apple flavor. Not an exciting cider, but may work well in a blend. Total tannins=0.06%.
For more info see: https://brixcider.com/cortland-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Egremont Russet
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
For cider - Medium body, noticeable alcohol. Moderate to high acidity, like tart cherry juice. Long finish. Little noticeable tannins. Total tannins=0.12%.
For more info see: https://brixcider.com/egremont-russet-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Gala
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Popular Eating Apple. For cider - Straight forward cider flavor. Medium body. Medium to low acidity. Little to no tannins. Simple. Clean, very easy to drink. Nothing exciting but not bad. Total tannins=0.05%.
For more info see: https://brixcider.com/gala-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Garfield
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
An apple grafted from a tree at the Garfield Farm Museum in LaFox, Illinois. Excellent cider. Nicely balanced. Intriguing aroma and full flavor. Intriguing story to the apple as well.Total tannins=0.16%.
For more info see: https://brixcider.com/garfield

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Gloster
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
For cider - Initial burst of flavor and gushing, juicy mouthfeel that fades to a lingering astringency. Moderate acidity and notable "bite" of alcohol. The astringent finish suggests more tannins than testing revealed. Good, full flavored cider with nice balance of acids. It stands up fairly well on its own or could be used to add some oomph to a weaker cider. Total tannins=0.12%.
For more info see: https://brixcider.com/gloster-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Grimes Golden
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Heirloom apple. For cider - Green apple skin. Even tart flavor from start to finish. Mild bitterness and astringency. Distinctly "green apple" cider. Refreshing, balanced. Very good on its own. Total tannins=0.12%.
For more info see: https://brixcider.com/grimes-golden-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Haralson
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Slightly tart apple from Minnesota. For cider - Light to medium body. Medium to slightly high acidity. A hint of something funky - perhaps something wasn't perfectly clean and happy during the fermentation (we don't claim to be perfect). Little to no noticeable tannins. Probably could have been better (blame the cider maker). Even so, it was a little thin. Could be used to add some acidity to a blend. Total tannins=0.10%.
For more info see: https://brixcider.com/haralson-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Hauer Pippin
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
For cider -Mellow, straight-forward apple flavor. Unassuming on first sip but a long, lingering finish. Moderate acidity. Little to no noticeable tannins. Light, subtle, and drinkable. Unadorned apple flavor and aroma. Would make a fine backdrop for blending with almost any apple. Total tannins=0.08%.
For more info see: https://brixcider.com/hauer-pippin-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Honeycrisp
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Popular eating variety. For cider - Medium to light body. Moderate acidity. Little to no noticeable tannins. Nothing exciting but not bad. Would make a good, neutral base for blending with other apples. Mild apple flavor. Total tannins=0.07%.
For more info see: https://brixcider.com/honeycrisp-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Lady Sweet
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Mild flavor. For cider - Low acidity. Light mouthfeel. Mild apple skin flavor. Little to no noticeable tannins. Mild cider overall. Nothing remarkable but nothing bad. Easy to drink. Could mellow an overly sharp cider. Total tannins=0.07%.
For more info see: https://brixcider.com/lady-sweet

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Macintosh
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Popular eating apple. For cider - Medium body. Fresh, tart apple flavor. Moderate to strong acidity. Overall Impression - This common eating apple makes a pleasant cider with the familiar tart apple flavor of a Mac. Great base apple. Could make for a world class cider if blended with a bittersweet. Total tannins=0.11%.
For more info see: https://brixcider.com/macintosh-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Minkler
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Heirloom apple from the 1800s. For cider - Moderate mouthfeel. Little acidity. Noticeable tannins, mildly bitter and astringent. Slightly woody, leathery flavor.
Overall Impression - A unique cider both in terms of the story of the apple and its uncommon flavor. Could be bumped up with a higher gravity, higher acidity apple, but interesting on its own.Total tannins=0.16%.
For more info see: https://brixcider.com/minkler-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Northwestern Greening
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Seeling apple from Iola Wisconson. For cider - Medium body leaning towards light. Nice acidity - not too strong, not too weak. Easy to drink, green apple flavor with a note of pine. Little to no noticeable tannins.
Overall Impression - Exceptionally drinkable cider. Light and refreshing. Total tannins=0.09%.
https://brixcider.com/northwest-greening-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Perry Russet
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Seeling apple from Iola Wisconson. For cider - Medium body. High acidity dominates the flavor, like "biting into a lemon" though there is nothing particularly citric about it. Long, tart, dry finish. No noticeable bitterness but some astringency.
Overall Impression - A good cider apple overall. Probably too tart on its own for most palettes, but the acidity and moderate astringency would lend well to a blend. Total tannins=0.19%.
For more info see - https://brixcider.com/perry-russet

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Plumb Cider
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Origin unknown, pleasant and juicy. For cider - Medium body. Medium to high acidity. Lightly drying and mildly bitter. Long, dry finish with lingering acidity and bitterness.
Overall Impression - Very good cider on its own. Nice balance of acidity and tannins. Total tannins=0.15%.
For more info see - https://brixcider.com/plumb-cider

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Raven
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Rich dark plum colored apple from Washington state For cider - Medium body. Very tart, like cranberry juice. Long finish. Little to no noticeable tannins.
Overall Impression - Great apple for bumping up the acidity of a blend. Full tart flavor. Total tannins=0.09%.
For more info see - https://brixcider.com/raven

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Razor Russet
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Similar to Golden Delicious. For cider - Medium body. Alcohol bite fills it out. Nice acidity level - not too high, not too low. Little to no noticeable tannins. Pleasant apple/grape flavor.
Overall Impression - A very good cider on its own. It's attractive, and everything is in nice balance (except that it lacks tannins). Total tannins=0.08%.
For more info see - https://brixcider.com/razor-russet-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Red Cortland
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Large, very similar to a regular Cortland, just a bit redder. For cider - Low to medium body. Light at first with a tart, lingering finish. Medium acidity overall. Little to no noticeable tannins.
Overall Impression - Very drinkable cider. Fine for a base apple. Might be nice to have a higher gravity apple to fill it out, but it's nonetheless enjoyable as a light, refreshing cider. Total tannins=0.06%.
For more info see - https://brixcider.com/red-cortland-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Russet Cow
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Crunchy medium size apple. For cider - Medium body. High acidity. Long, tart finish. Little to no noticeable tannins.
Overall Impression - Perhaps too one dimensional to stand on its own but could be used to add acidity to a blend. Total tannins=0.06%.
For more info see - https://brixcider.com/russet-cow

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Shiawassee
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
For cider - Moderate, soft mouthfeel that gives way to full and long lasting acidity. Little noticeable tannins.
Overall Impression - Great for adding aromatics and acidity to a blend, a little too acidic on its own. Total tannins=0.10%.
For more info see - https://brixcider.com/shiawassee

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Slippery Cider
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
For cider - Medium body. Medium to high acidity. Not much noticeable tannin presence except that the flavor seems lightly nutty and spiced.
Overall Impression - A good cider but not exceptional. Interesting in subtle ways. Could benefit from higher gravity or more tannins. Total tannins=0.15%.
For more info see - https://brixcider.com/slippery-cider-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Smokehouse
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
For cider -Medium body and acidity. The residual sweetness is more noticeable than it was for most of the ciders we tested (we won't speculate as to the reason since there are a number of possible explanations). Not much noticeable tannin except for a hint of astringency on the finish. Overall Impression - Very drinkable. Very good. Well balanced on its own and great for a base. Total tannins=0.15%.
For more info see - https://brixcider.com/smokehouse-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Stump
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
For cider - Light to medium body. Low to medium acidity. Mild apple flavor. Little to no noticeable tannins.
Overall Impression - Unremarkable, but not bad. Total tannins=0.10%.
For more info see - https://brixcider.com/stump

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Wisconsin Russet
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Also known as Jeidy Russet. For cider - Full body. High acidity. Rich, puckery fruit flavors. Long, mouth-watering finish. Mild bitterness and astringency rounds out the cider.
Overall Impression - Very good cider. From it's cold Wisconsin home, this apple produces a surprising, tart fruit punch that brings memories of warmer weather and can carry one away to a bright, tropical place even on a wintry night. Total tannins=0.25%.
For more info see - https://brixcider.com/wisconsin-russet-apple-cider-evaluation

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Apple Juice - Wolf River
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
From the banks of the Wolf River in Wisconsin. For cider - Low to medium body. Classic tart apple flavor. Little to no noticeable tannins. Overall Impression - Good base apple with a straight-forward tart apple flavor. Would be enjoyable on a hot day when floating down the Wolf River. Total tannins=0.11%.
For more info see - https://brixcider.com/new-page

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Aromatic Malt (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Smooth, Intensely Malty COLOR CONTRIBUTION: Rich Golden Hues CHARACTERISTICS AND APPLICATIONS Munich-style malt that will contribute an intensely malty flavor and aroma. Use in any beer style for additional maltiness.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Barley Hulls
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Hulls are introduced to improve the speed of lautering when making high gravity or high adjunct beers. Hulls are neutral in flavor, body and color, and are inert Good for wheat beers, Wits, and others that have high protein mashes.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Barley, Flaked
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds significant body to Porters and Stouts. High haze producing protein prevents use in light beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Barley, Flaked (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Use at 10-25% to produce a light colored, mild flavored, dry beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Barley, Raw
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Raw, unmalted barley can be used to add body to your beer. Use in homebrew requires very fine milling combined with a decoction or multi-stage mash. Performs best when used in small quantities with well modified grains.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Barley, Torrefied
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Raw barley that has been "popped" open to open kernels Used in place of raw barley for faster conversion and higher yields. High in haze producing protein

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black (Patent) Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark color and dry roasted flavor characteristic of Stouts and Porters Use for: Coloring in small amounts, or flavoring of Stouts and Porters in larger amounts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black Barley (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Coffee, Intense Bitter, Dry COLOR: Deep Brown provides color and rich, sharp flavor characteristic of Stouts and some Porters a dryness to Stout or Porter. not interchangeable with Black Malt Use 3-7% for a dry Porter Use 5-15% for dry Stout

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black Barley (Stout)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Unmalted barley roasted at high temperature to create a dry, coffee like flavor. Imparts a sharp acrid flavor characteristic of dry stouts. Gives "dryness" to a stout or porter -- much more so than regular Roasted Barley

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black Cherry Juice - Knudsen
FERMENTABLE.NOTES:
Knudsen's 'Just Black Cherry' juice suitable for use in mead, wine, cider, beer. Sold in 1 quart jars. Pasteurized but has no preservatives making it suitable for fermentation. SRM color listed is a rough estimate.
Note - their tart cherry has more tannins and will produce more flavor post-fermentation.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black Currant Juice - Knudsen
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Knudsen's 'Just Black Currant' juice suitable for use in mead, wine, cider, beer. Sold in 1 quart jars. Pasteurized but has no preservatives making it suitable for fermentation. SRM color listed is a rough estimate.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black Malt - 2-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR Neutral CHAR:Use for color adjustment Provides color and sharp, almost acrid, flavor characteristic of Stouts and Porters Use 1-10% for desired color in Porter and Stout. has a distinctive malty flavor not interchangeable with Roasted Barley

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black Malt - 6-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR Neutral CHAR:Use for color adjustment Provides color and sharp, almost acrid, flavor characteristic of Stouts and Porters Use 1-10% for desired color in Porter and Stout. has a distinctive malty flavor not interchangeable with Roasted Barley

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Blueberry Juice - Knudsen
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Knudsen's 'Just Blueberry' juice suitable for use in mead, wine, cider, beer. Sold in 1 quart jars. Pasteurized but has no preservatives making it suitable for fermentation. SRM color listed is a rough estimate.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Borlander Munich Malt (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Flavor:Smooth Malty and Sweet Color: Golden-Orange Hues Sufficient enzymes for self-conversion Smooth yet pronounced malty flavor plus sweetness Great in Bock beers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Brewers Malt 2-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Flavor:Mild Malty Smoother, less grainy flavor than 6-row

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Brewers Malt 6-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Flavor:Mild Grainy Malty More husk than 2-row, well suited for high adjunct brewing

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Brown Sugar, Dark
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Imparts a rich sweet flavor. Used in Scottish ales, holiday ales and some old ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Brown Sugar, Light
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Imparts a rich sweet flavor. Used in Scottish ales, holiday ales and some old ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Cane (Beet) Sugar
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Common household baking sugar. Lightens flavor and body of beer. Can contribute a cider-like flavor to the beer if not cold-fermented or used in large quantities.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Cara-Pils/Dextrine
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Significantly increases foam/head retention and body of the beer. Also sold under the names "Dextrine" and "Cara-Foam"

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caraamber
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention. Also called "Crystal" malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafoam
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Significantly increases foam/head retention and body of the beer. Also sold under the names "Dextrine" and "Cara-Pils (TM)"

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 10L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Candy-like Sweetness, Mild Carmel Golden Color 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness and color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body, head retention and stability

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 10L 6-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Candy-like Sweetness, Mild Carmel Golden Color 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness and color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body and head retention and stability

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 120L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pronounced Caramel, Burnt Sugar, Raisiny, Prunes Deep Red Color 3-15% in Amber and Red beers. 10-15% in Bock 7-15% in Dark beers 10-15% in Porter and Stout

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 120L 6-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pronounced Caramel, Burnt Sugar, Raisiny, Prunes Deep Red Color 3-15% in Amber and Red beers. 10-15% in Bock 7-15% in Dark beers 10-15% in Porter and Stout

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 120L Organic (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pronounced Caramel, Burnt Sugar, Raisiny, Prunes Deep Red Color 3-15% in Amber and Red beers. 10-15% in Bock 7-15% in Dark beers 10-15% in Porter and Stout

FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Candy-like Sweetness, Mild Carmel Golden Color 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness and color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body and head retention and stability

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 30L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Sweet, Caramel, Toffee Golden Color 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness and color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body and head retention and stability

FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Sweet, Caramel, Toffee Golden Color 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness and color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body and head retention and stability

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 40L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Sweet, Caramel, Toffee Golden to lighr red hues 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness and color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body and head retention and stability

FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Sweet, Caramel, Toffee Golden to lighr red hues 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness and color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body and head retention and stability

FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Sweet, Pronounced Caramel Golden to lighr red hues 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness and color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body and head retention and stabili

FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Sweet, Pronounced Caramel Deep Golden to Red color 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness and color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body and head retention and stabili

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 60L 6-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Sweet, Pronounced Caramel Golden to lighr red hues 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness and color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body and head retention and stabili

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 60L Organic (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Sweet, Pronounced Caramel Deep Golden to Red color 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness and color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body and head retention and stabili

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 80L 6-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pronounced Caramel, Slight Burnt Sugar, Raisniny, Prune Red to Deep Red 3-15% in Amber and Red beers. 10-15% in Bock beers. 7-15% in Dark beers. 10-15% in Porter and Stout.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 90L 6-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pronounced Caramel, Slight Burnt Sugar, Raisniny, Prune Red to Deep Red 3-15% in Amber and Red beers. 10-15% in Bock beers. 7-15% in Dark beers. 10-15% in Porter and Stout.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Munich 60L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Caramel, Roasted, Malty Amber to Red Color Excellent in IPAs, Pale Ales, Oktoberfests and Porters.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Vienne 20L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Caramel, Malty Golden Color contributes both mild caramel sweetness and maltiness. Excellent in Vienna-style Lagers and Belgian-style Abbey Ales. Produced from AMBA/BMBRI recommended 2-Row Malting Barley varieties.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 10L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention. Also called "Crystal" malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 20L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention. Also called "Crystal" malt.

FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention. Also called "Crystal" malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carared
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention. Also called "Crystal" malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Rich Roasted Coffee COLOR: Brown Hues, depending upon usage color adj with minor/no flavor contribution 1-10% for color in Porter and Stout The choc flavor is very complementary when used in higher % in Brown Ales, Porters, Stouts and other Dark
